name: Object recognizer
tagline: Takes an image and creates a database of the objects in it. A second image is then fed into the program to see if any of the same objects exist in the second image.
body:
Takes an image of objects such as this: 
![original](https://raw.github.com/aneemtalukder/object_recognizer/master/two_objects.png)

Converts it to a binary image:
![binary image](https://raw.github.com/aneemtalukder/object_recognizer/master/binary_image.jpg)

Then determines the different objects with a sequential labeling algorithm. They are given different color values to visually tell the different objects:
![labeled objects](https://raw.github.com/aneemtalukder/object_recognizer/master/labeled_objects.png)

Creates a database of the objects and its features. These include center of mass, minimum moment and orientation. Line of orientation and center are plotted:
![object features](https://raw.github.com/aneemtalukder/object_recognizer/master/parsed_objects.png)

Takes another image such as this:
![another image](https://raw.github.com/aneemtalukder/object_recognizer/master/many_objects_1.png)

And if some objects are recognized, those objects' orientations and centers are drawn:
![recognized objects](https://raw.github.com/aneemtalukder/object_recognizer/master/recognized.png)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
